result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Josua Ismael Mendoza

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 10:13 AM Defendant Josua Ismael Mendoza in court.  Attorney Wesley J Kottke in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Christine Bruen in court for Josua Ismael Mendoza. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant. Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained.  Consequences explained for failure to abide by terms of PPDA. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea:  Cts 1 & 2 - NC.  Court accepts plea and stays JOC.  Court accepts terms and conditions of PPDA.  Matter stayed for 12 months. The Court reminds the defendant that bond remains in effect throughout the pendency of the PPDA.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Dennis Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Christine Bruen appeared by phone for Josua Ismael Mendoza. Atty Bruen requests a P/S hearing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 2:08 PM Defendant Josua Ismael Mendoza in court.  Attorney Matthew Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Christine Bruen in court for Josua Ismael Mendoza. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  NGP entered. Bond argument by DA Leusink. No objection by Atty Bruen. Court orders $1000 Sig Bond.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Status conference on April 27, 2022 at 11:45 am.
